tests.criteria: Uses semantic HTML elements (header, nav, main, section, article)
tests.details: Consider using semantic HTML elements instead of generic divs
suggestions: Replace divs with semantic elements like <section>, <article>, <nav>

tests.details: Heading hierarchy detected - manual verification recommended
Consider using proper list elements for mapped content
suggestions: Wrap mapped items in <ul> or <ol> elements

tests.criteria: All interactive elements have accessible names
aria-label or aria-labelledby present where needed
aria-hidden used appropriately for decorative elements
All interactive elements are keyboard accessible

tests.details: Lists and menus should support arrow key navigation
suggestions: Add arrow key navigation for list/menu items

tests.criteria: Touch targets work on mobile devices
Text contrast meets WCAG AA (4.5:1) minimum
tests.details: Use WCAG AA compliant color tokens
suggestions: Use accessible color classes or CSS custom properties

tests.criteria: Color not the only means of conveying information
All content available to screen readers
Screen reader only content (sr-only) used appropriately
tests.details: Icons should have screen reader accessible text
suggestions: Add sr-only text for icons or use aria-label

tests.details: Dynamic content changes should be announced
suggestions: Add aria-live regions for dynamic content

tests.criteria: Status updates announced to screen readers
Components work with mobile screen readers
